result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Yuri Hawk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 16 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Civil judgment to be entered against defendant for court ordered financial obligations.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Complete a mental health assessment and follow-through with recommendations, and Neuro-psychological work-up and follow-through with recommendations. Take all medications as prescribed. Comply with treatment providers.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant to write a letter of apology and give to Agent who will determine whether to forward to victim. Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry, including Electric Monitoring. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
